Name: Software Update : Automatically check new software updates
Graphical Method:
->1. Open System Preferences
->2. Select Software Update
->3. Select Advanced
->4. Verify that « Check for updates » is selected
Intro: Auto Update verifies that your system has the newest security patches and software updates. If "Automatically check for updates" is not selected background updates for new malware definition files from Apple for XProtect and Gatekeeper will not occur.
Consequences: Without automatic update, updates may not be made in a timely manner and the system will be exposed to additional risk.
Advice: It is important that a system has the newest updates applied so as to prevent unauthorized persons from exploiting identified vulnerabilities.

Name: Screen Saver : Enable prompt for a password on screen saver
Graphical Method:
->    1. Open System Preferences
->    2. Select Security & Privacy
->    3. Verify that “Require password <time> after sleep or screen saver begin“ is selected
Intro: This policy ask for a password after sleep or screen saver begins

Name: Screen Saver : Set password delay
Graphical Method:
->    1. Open System Preferences
->    2. Select Security & Privacy
->    3. Verify that “Require password <time> after sleep or screen saver begin“ <time> is set to immediately
Intro: This policy set the time after the password is asked
Advice: If true, the user is prompted for a password when the screen saver is unlocked or stopped. When you use this prompt, you must also provide askForPasswordDelay. Available in macOS 10.13 and later. Default: false

Name: Screen Saver : Set an inactivity interval for the screen saver
Graphical Method:
->    1. Open System Preferences
->    2. Desktop & ScreenSaver
->    3. Verify that “Show Screen saver after “ is set to 20 minutes
Intro: This policy set an inactivity interval before Screen saver
Advice: The number of seconds to delay before the password will be required to unlock or stop the screen saver (the grace period). A value of 2147483647 (for example, 0x7FFFFFFF) disables this requirement. To use this option, you must set askForPassword to true. Available in macOS 10.13 and later.

Name: Screen Saver : Secure screen saver corners (top-left)
Graphical Method: -> 1. Open System Preferences -> 2. Select Desktop & Screen Saver -> 3. Select Screen Saver -> 4. Select Hot Corners... and verify that Disable Screen Saver is not set
Intro: Hot Corners can be configured to disable the screen saver by moving the mouse cursor to a corner of the screen.
Consequences: If the screensaver is not set users may leave the computer available for an unauthorized person to access information.
Advice: Setting an inactivity interval for the screensaver prevents unauthorized persons from viewing a system left unattended for an extensive period of time.
Possible values: Int : 1 (-) ; 2 (Mission Control) ; 3 (Application Window) ; 4 (Desktop) ; 5 (Start Screen Saver) ; 6 (Disable Screen Saver) ; 10 (Put Display to sleep) ; 11 (Launchpad) ; 12 (Notification Centre) ; 13 (Lock Screen)
